name: XVerExtensionClaimResponse.addItem.detail
title: Cross-Version Extension for FHIR R5:ClaimResponse.addItem.detail compared to FHIR R4
description: R5 `ClaimResponse.addItem.detail` maps as Equivalent to R4 `ClaimResponse.addItem.detail`

element.definition: The second-tier service adjudications for payor added services.
element.comment: R5 `ClaimResponse.addItem.detail` maps as Equivalent to R4 `ClaimResponse.addItem.detail`

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.definition: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

slicing.description: Extensions are always sliced by (at least) url

element.definition: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. To make the use of extensions safe and managable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.
element.comment: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.short: identifies the meaning of the extension
element.definition: Source of the definition for the extension code - a logical name or a URL.
element.comment: The definition may point directly to a computable or human-readable definition of the extensibility codes, or it may be a logical URI as declared in some other specification. The definition SHALL be a URI for the Structure Definition defining the extension.

element.definition: Value of extension - must be one of a constrained set of the data types (see [Extensibility](extensibility.html) for a list).

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: Trace number for tracking purposes. May be defined at the jurisdiction level or between trading partners.
The type of revenue or cost center providing the product and/or service.

element.short: Billing, service, product, or drug code
element.definition: When the value is a group code then this item collects a set of related item details, otherwise this contains the product, service, drug or other billing code for the item. This element may be the start of a range of .productOrService codes used in conjunction with .productOrServiceEnd or it may be a solo element where .productOrServiceEnd is not used.
element.comment: If this is an actual service or product line, i.e. not a Group, then use code to indicate the Professional Service or Product supplied (e.g. CTP, HCPCS, USCLS, ICD10, NCPDP, DIN, RxNorm, ACHI, CCI). If a grouping item then use a group code to indicate the type of thing being grouped e.g. 'glasses' or 'compound'.

element.short: End of a range of codes
element.definition: This contains the end of a range of product, service, drug or other billing codes for the item. This element is not used when the .productOrService is a group code. This value may only be present when a .productOfService code has been provided to convey the start of the range. Typically this value may be used only with preauthorizations and not with claims.
Item typification or modifiers codes to convey additional context for the product or service.
element.comment: For example in Oral whether the treatment is cosmetic or associated with TMJ, or for Medical whether the treatment was outside the clinic or outside of office hours.

element.definition: The number of repetitions of a service or product.

element.short: Fee, charge or cost per item
element.definition: If the item is not a group then this is the fee for the product or service, otherwise this is the total of the fees for the details of the group.

A real number that represents a multiplier used in determining the overall value of services delivered and/or goods received. The concept of a Factor allows for a discount or surcharge multiplier to be applied to a monetary amount.
element.comment: To show a 10% senior's discount, the value entered is: 0.90 (1.00 - 0.10).

element.definition: The total of taxes applicable for this product or service.
The total amount claimed for the group (if a grouper) or the addItem.detail. Net = unit price * quantity * factor.
element.comment: For example, the formula: quantity * unitPrice * factor  = net. Quantity and factor are assumed to be 1 if not supplied.

element.definition: The numbers associated with notes below which apply to the adjudication of this item.

element.short: Added items detail level adjudication results
element.definition: The high-level results of the adjudication if adjudication has been performed.
The adjudication results.
The third-tier service adjudications for payor added services.

The total amount claimed for the addItem.detail.subDetail. Net = unit price * quantity * factor.

element.definition: The numbers associated with notes below which apply to the adjudication of this item.

The adjudication results.
